intro: Downingia tricolor, commonly known as the three-color rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually white, yellow, and purple, giving it its common name. Downingia tricolor is often found in alpine and coastal environments, where it adapts to harsh, windy conditions.
